  • Chris Lilley
  • Garret Rieger
  • Myles Maxfield

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/RangeRequest/

MediaStreamTrack Insertable Media Processing using Streams

<p>This API defines an API surface for manipulating the bits on <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/mediacapture-streams/#mediastreamtrack">MediaStreamTracks</a> carrying raw data.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Harald Alvestrand
  • Guido Urdaneta

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/mediacapture-transform/

VSSo: Vehicle Signal Specification Ontology

<p>As the core ontology defined the structure, VSSo holds the vocabulary as defined by the standard catalogue. The main objective is, that VSSo doesn't diverege from the standard catalogue, so this is done automatically through tooling provided in the corresponding repository. The tooling takes the standard catalogue and maps it to concepts defined in the core ontology. The result is an OWL complient ontology, following the standard catalogue of VSS.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Benjamin Klotz
  • Raphaël Troncy
  • Daniel Wilms

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/vsso/

VSSo Core: Vehicle Signal Specification Core Ontology

<p>The core ontology introduces concepts for the structural elements of VSS defined through the rule set in the specifications. Figure 1 gives an overview of those. The root node is the Vehicle itself. From there the structure is given through so-called Branches. They serve as sorting element for the leaf nodes and are not specified in the specification itself in greater details. The leaf nodes contain the semantic information of signals, which expext to describe and hold information, which changes in greater frequency and of attributes, which are more static. The core of the ontology defines this structure in an OWL ontology and serves as a basis for the defined signals of the standard catalogue and potential further development of the branches as more than structural information.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Benjamin Klotz
  • Raphaël Troncy
  • Daniel Wilms

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/vsso-core/

MiniApp Widget Requirements

<p>The MiniApp Widget is a special form of MiniApp Page. Unlike a page, a widget can occupy a certain area instead of the entire screen. It is used to display key information and respond to simple user operations, such as displaying the weather at the user’s current location, or tracking the user’s current travel status and providing further actions.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Chen Yinli
  • Canfeng Chen
  • Bingqing Zhou
  • Bin Guo

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/miniapp-widget-req/

MiniApp Addressing

<p>This specification defines how MiniApps are located, which is called MiniApp Addressing, including the specifications for specific MiniApp URI syntax components based on the URI specification, and the process to dereference the MiniApp URI. Implementing this specification enables the user agent to locate the resources of MiniApp.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Dan Zhou
  • Qian Liu
  • shuo wang
  • Tengyuan Zhang

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/miniapp-addressing/

Autoplay Policy Detection

<p>This specification provides web developers the ability to detect if automatically starting the playback of a media file is allowed in different situations.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Alastor Wu

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/autoplay-detection/

Perso-arabic Kashmiri Gap Analysis

<p>This document describes and prioritises gaps for the support of Kashmiri language using the Perso-arabic orthography on the Web and in eBooks. In particular, it is concerned with text layout. It checks that needed features are supported in W3C specifications, in particular HTML and CSS and those relating to digital publications. It also checks whether the features have been implemented in browsers and ereaders. This is a preliminary analysis.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Richard Ishida

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/arab-ks-gap/

<p>This document describes and prioritises gaps for the support of Uighur on the Web and in eBooks. In particular, it is concerned with text layout. It checks that needed features are supported in W3C specifications, in particular HTML and CSS and those relating to digital publications. It also checks whether the features have been implemented in browsers and ereaders. This is a preliminary analysis.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Richard Ishida

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/arab-ug-gap/

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Chris Lilley

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/font-rationale/

Capture Handle - Bootstrapping Collaboration when Screensharing

<p>This document proposes a mechanism by which an application APP can opt-in to exposing certain information with another application CAPTR, if CAPTR is screen-capturing the tab in which APP is running. It describes a mechanism for tab capture only.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Elad Alon
  • Jan-Ivar Bruaroey

DAPT Requirements

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Cyril Concolato

Privacy Principles

<p>This document provides definitions for privacy and related concepts that are applicable worldwide. It also provides a set of privacy principles that should guide the development of the Web as a trustworthy platform. People using the Web would benefit from a stronger relationship between technology and policy, and this document is written to work with both.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Robin Berjon
  • Jeffrey Yasskin

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/privacy-principles/

W3C TAG Ethical Web Principles

<p>The web should be a platform that helps people and provides a positive social benefit. As we continue to evolve the web platform, we must therefore consider the consequences of our work. The following document sets out ethical principles that will drive the W3C's continuing work in this direction.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Daniel Appelquist
  • Hadley Beeman
  • Amy Guy

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/ethical-web-principles/

MathML Media-type Declarations

  • Paul Libbrecht

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/mathml-media-types/

Accessibility Maturity Model

<p>The W3C Accessibility Maturity Model is a guide for organizations to evaluate and improve their business processes to produce digital products that are accessible to people with disabilities. Use of the W3C Accessibility Maturity Model will provide organizations informative guidance (guidance that is not normative and does not set requirements) on improving accessibility policies, processes, and outcomes.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • David Fazio
  • Charles LaPierre
  • Janina Sajka

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/maturity-model/

HEVC (H.265) WebCodecs Registration

<p>This registration is entered into the [webcodecs-codec-registry]. It describes, for HEVC (H.265), the (1) fully qualified codec strings, (2) the codec-specific EncodedVideoChunk [[internal data]] bytes, (3) the VideoDecoderConfig.description bytes, (4) the values of EncodedVideoChunk [[type]], and (5) the codec-specific extensions to VideoEncoderConfig</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Paul Adenot
  • Bernard Aboba

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/webcodecs-hevc-codec-registration/

Trusted Types

<p>An API that allows applications to lock down powerful APIs to only accept non-spoofable, typed values in place of strings to prevent vulnerabilities caused by using these APIs with attacker-controlled inputs.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Krzysztof Kotowicz

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/trusted-types/

A Well-Known URL for Changing Passwords

<p>This specification defines a well-known URL that sites can use to make their change password forms discoverable by tools. This simple affordance provides a way for software to help the user find the way to change their password.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Ricky Mondello
  • Theresa O'Connor

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/change-password-url/

CSS View Transitions Module Level 1

  • Tab Atkins Jr.
  • Jake Archibald
  • Khushal Sagar

Scroll-driven Animations

<p>Defines an API and markup for creating animations that are tied to the scroll offset of a scroll container.</p>

  • Botond Ballo
  • Antoine Quint
  • Olga Gerchikov
  • Elika Etemad
  • Robert Flack

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/scroll-animations-1/

Collaboration Tools Accessibility User Requirements

<p>This document outlines various accessibility-related user needs, requirements and scenarios for collaboration tools. The tools of interest are distinguished by their support for one or more specific collaborative features. These features include real-time editing of content by multiple authors, the use of comments or annotations, and revision control. A Web-based text editor or word processor offering all of these features would be a central example of such a collaboration tool.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Jason White
  • Janina Sajka
  • Scott Hollier

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/ctaur/

Verifiable Credential Data Integrity 1.0

<p>This specification describes mechanisms for ensuring the authenticity and integrity of Verifiable Credentials and similar types of constrained digital documents using cryptography, especially through the use of digital signatures and related mathematical proofs.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Manu Sporny
  • Dave Longley
  • Greg Bernstein
  • Dmitri Zagidulin
  • Sebastian Crane

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-integrity/

RDF Dataset Canonicalization

<p>RDF [RDF11-CONCEPTS] describes a graph-based data model for making claims about the world and provides the foundation for reasoning upon that graph of information. At times, it becomes necessary to compare the differences between sets of graphs, digitally sign them, or generate short identifiers for graphs via hashing algorithms. This document outlines an algorithm for normalizing RDF datasets such that these operations can be performed.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Dave Longley
  • Gregg Kellogg
  • Dan Yamamoto

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/rdf-canon/

JSON Web Signatures for Data Integrity Proofs

<p>This specification describes a JSON Web Signature Suite created in 2020 for the Verifiable Credentials Data Integrity Proof specification. The Signature Suite utilizes Detached JWS signatures to provide support for a subset of the digital signature algorithms registered with IANA.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Orie Steele
  • Michael Jones

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-jws-2020/

W3C Alternative and Augmented Communication (AAC) Symbol Registry

<p>This is a W3C registry of symbols used in augmentative and alternative communication (AAC). It is co-published with Blissymbolics Communication International and contains their full set of authorized symbols. With over 5000 symbols, this set can function as a basis for semantic mappings between different AAC symbol sets in use around the world, using the entries in this registry to identify common meanings. This functionality is necessary for interoperable implementation of the WAI-Adapt: Symbols Module (draft symbols module, currently part of the WAI-ADAPT: Content Module [adapt-content]). This registry is available for other use cases as well.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/aac-registry/

Compute Pressure Level 1

<p>The Compute Pressure API provides a way for websites to react to changes in the CPU pressure of the target device, such that websites can trade off resources for an improved user experience. </p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Kenneth Christiansen
  • Arnaud Mandy

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/compute-pressure/

Contact Picker API

<p>An API to give one-off access to a user’s contact information with full control over the shared data.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Peter Beverloo

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/contact-picker/

Web Locks API

<p>This document defines a web platform API that allows script to asynchronously acquire a lock over a resource, hold it while work is performed, then release it. While held, no other script in the origin can acquire a lock over the same resource. This allows contexts (windows, workers) within a web application to coordinate the usage of resources.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Joshua Bell
  • Kagami Rosylight

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/web-locks/

Gurmukhi Layout Requirements

<p>This document describes requirements for the layout and presentation of text in the Punjabi language, using the Gurmukhi script when they are used by Web standards and technologies, such as HTML, CSS, Mobile Web, Digital Publications, and Unicode.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Richard Ishida

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/guru-lreq/

EPUB Type to ARIA Role Authoring Guide 1.1

<p>This document provides guidance for publishers looking to move from the use of the EPUB 3 epub:type attribute to ARIA roles for accessibility.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Matt Garrish

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/epub-aria-authoring-11/

Badging API

<p>This specification defines an API that allows installed web applications to set an application badge, which is usually shown alongside the application's icon on the device's home screen or application dock.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Marcos Caceres
  • Diego Gonzalez-Zuniga

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/badging/

Data Integrity EdDSA Cryptosuites v1.0

<p>This specification describes a Data Integrity cryptographic suite for use when creating or verifying a digital signature using the twisted Edwards Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (EdDSA) and Curve25519 (ed25519).</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Manu Sporny
  • Dmitri Zagidulin
  • Greg Bernstein
  • Sebastian Crane

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-di-eddsa/

Data Integrity ECDSA Cryptosuites v1.0

<p>This specification describes a Data Integrity Cryptosuite for use when generating a digital signature using the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA) based on the Standards for Efficient Cryptography over prime fields using a verifiably random Elliptic Curve (secpr1).</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Manu Sporny
  • Martin Reed
  • Greg Bernstein
  • Sebastian Crane

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-di-ecdsa/

Dubbing and Audio description Profiles of TTML2

<p>This specification defines DAPT, a TTML-based file format for the exchange of timed text content in dubbing and audio description workflows. </p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Cyril Concolato
  • Nigel Megitt

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/dapt/

Securing Verifiable Credentials using JOSE and COSE

<p>This specification defines how to secure Verifiable Credentials with JSON Object Signing and Encryption (JOSE) especially as explified by JSON Web Signatures (JWS) [RFC7515] and with CBOR Object Signing and Encryption (COSE) [RFC8152]. This enables the Verifiable Credential data model [VC-DATA-MODEL]to be implemented with standards for signing and encryption that are widely adopted.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Michael Jones
  • Michael Prorock
  • Gabe Cohen

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-jose-cose/

Bitstring Status List v1.0

<p>This specification describes a privacy-preserving, space-efficient, and high-performance mechanism for publishing status information such as suspension or revocation of Verifiable Credentials through use of bitstrings.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Manu Sporny
  • Dave Longley
  • Michael Prorock
  • Mahmoud Alkhraishi

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-bitstring-status-list/

BBS Cryptosuite v2023

<p>This specification describes the BBS+ Signature Suite created in 2023 for the Data Integrity specification. The Signature Suite utilizes BBS+ signatures to provide the capability of zero knowledge proof disclosures.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Greg Bernstein
  • Manu Sporny

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-di-bbs/

Verifiable Credentials JSON Schema Specification

<p>Among other things, the [VC-DATA-MODEL] specifies the models used for Verifiable Credentials, Verifiable Presentations, and explains the relationships between three parties: issuers, holders, and verifiers. Critical pieces of functionality referenced throughout the [VC-DATA-MODEL] are the that of of verifiability, extensibility, and semantic interoperability. This specification provides a mechanism to make use of a Credential Schema in Verifiable Credential, leveraging the existing Data Schemas concept.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Gabe Cohen
  • Michael Prorock
  • Andres Uribe

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-json-schema/

RDF 1.2 Semantics

<p>This document describes a precise semantics for the RDF 1.2 Concepts and Abstract Syntax and RDF 1.2 Schema. It defines a number of distinct entailment regimes and corresponding patterns of entailment. It is part of a suite of documents which comprise the full specification of RDF 1.2.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Peter Patel-Schneider
  • Dörthe Arndt
  • Timothée Haudebourg

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/rdf12-semantics/

N'Ko Layout Requirements

<p>This document describes requirements for the layout and presentation of text in a koiné register of Manding called Kángbɛ, using the N'Ko script when they are used by Web standards and technologies, such as HTML, CSS, Mobile Web, Digital Publications, and Unicode.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Richard Ishida

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/nkoo-lreq/

CSS Anchor Positioning

<p>This specification defines 'anchor positioning', where a positioned element can size and position itself relative to one or more "anchor elements" elsewhere on the page.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Tab Atkins Jr.
  • Ian Kilpatrick

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/css-anchor-position-1/

Korean Layout Gap Analysis

<p>This document describes and prioritises gaps for the support of Korean language on the Web and in eBooks. In particular, it is concerned with text layout. It checks that needed features are supported in W3C specifications, in particular HTML and CSS and those relating to digital publications. It also checks whether the features have been implemented in browsers and ereaders.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Fuqiao Xue
  • Richard Ishida

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/kore-gap/

<p>This Vision attempts to help the world understand what W3C is, what it does and why that matters; and in particular to articulate the principles by which it operates and that guide its decisions.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Chris Wilson

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/w3c-vision/

Catalan Gap Analysis

<p>This document describes and prioritises gaps for the support of Catalan on the Web and in eBooks. In particular, it is concerned with text layout. It checks that needed features are supported in W3C specifications, in particular HTML and CSS and those relating to digital publications. It also checks whether the features have been implemented in browsers and ereaders.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Richard Ishida

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/latn-ca-gap/

WebVMT: The Web Video Map Tracks Format

<p>This specification defines WebVMT, the Web Video Map Tracks format, which is an enabling technology whose main use is for marking up external metadata track resources in connection with the HTML <track> element. WebVMT files provide map presentation, annotation and interpolation synchronized to web media content, and more generally any form of data that is time-aligned with audio or video content, including those from location-aware devices such as dashcams, drones and smartphones. </p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Rob Smith

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/webvmt/

Client-Edge-Cloud coordination Use Cases and Requirements

<p>This document introduces the use cases and requirements of client, edge, cloud coordination mechanism and its standardization.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Dapeng(Max) Liu
  • Michael McCool
  • Song XU

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/edge-cloud-reqs/

The EPUB Accessibility exemption property

<p>The <code>exemption</code> property allows EPUB creators to indicate that an EPUB publication that does not meet accessibility conformance requirements has an exemption under the applicable jurisdiction's laws.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Matt Garrish
  • Gregorio Pellegrino

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/epub-a11y-exemption/

<p>This is a supporting document for the RDF Dataset Canonicalization specification, providing some extra explanation of the problem space and associated use cases.</p>

Szerkesztő(k):

  • Phil Archer

További információ: https://www.w3.org/TR/rch-explainer/
